page.title: 08PUNJABI SCHOOL
page.content: Every Saturday morning I wake up at 7 o clock ready to go to Punjabi School. After eating breakfast my brother and I go to my brother's friend's house. He also goes to the same school. School starts at 10 o clock. It is held at Beconsfield School. There are 3 Punjabi classes and 2 Hindi classes. We have our class in a home economics room. Our teacher is paid by the Ealing Borough. The headmaster and caretaker are also paid by Ealing. School ends at half past twelve. We then show our mother what we did at school. We normally write letters and learn words. We are given homework. I enjoy punjabi School and find it a good way to learn my mother tongue.
